sen.j: 内匠寮（ないしょうりょう）は律令制において中務省に属する令外官の一つである。
sen.e: Naishoryo is one of the ranks which are outside of the Ritsuryo system and which belong to the Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) under the Ritsuryo system.
Naishoryo is one of the ranks outside the Ritsuryo system belonging to the Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) under the Ritsuryo system.
Naishoryo is one of the ranks outside the Ritsuryo system belonging to the Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) under the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 訓読みはたくみりょう・うちたくみのつかさなど。
sen.e: Japanese readings include "takumiryo" and "uchitakumi no tsukasa".
Japanese readings include "takumiryo" and "uchitakumi no tsukasa".
Japanese readings include "takumiryo" and "uchitakumi no tsukasa."

sen.j: 内匠寮は神亀5年（728年）聖武天皇の時に新設された。
sen.e: Naishoryo was newly established in 774 under Emperor Shomu.
Naishoryo was newly established in 774 under Emperor Shomu.
Naishoryo was newly established in 728 under Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 職掌は天皇家の調度品や儀式用具などの製作である。
sen.e: The official duty is manufacture of furnishing goods and ritual equipments for the Emperor's family.
The official duty is the manufacture of furnishing goods and ritual equipment for the Emperor's family.
The official duty is the manufacture of furnishing goods and ritual equipment for the Emperor's family.

sen.j: また宝亀5年（774年）に大蔵省律令制における大蔵省典鋳司を、大同 (日本)3年（808年）には中務省画工司と大蔵省漆部司を合併して規模を拡大した。
sen.e: Furthermore, the scale was expanded by placing imonono tsukasa (casting bureau) of the Okura-sho under the Ritsuryo system of the Okura-sho in 774, and by merging the gakoshi (painting bureau) of the Nakatsukasa-sho and the nuribeshi (lacquering bureau) of the Okura-sho in 808.

Furthermore, the scale was expanded by placing imonono tsukasa (casting bureau) of the Okura-sho under the Ritsuryo system of the Okura-sho in 774, and by merging the gakoshi (painting bureau) of the Nakatsukasa-sho and the nuribeshi (lacquering bureau) of the Okura-sho in 808.

Furthermore, the scale was expanded by placing imonono tsukasa (casting bureau) of the Okura-sho under the Ritsuryo system of the Okura-sho in 774, and by merging the gakoshi (painting bureau) of the Nakatsukasa-sho and the nuribeshi (lacquering bureau) of the Okura-sho in 808.

sen.j: 平安時代前期から中期には官営工房の元締めとして機能した。
sen.e: Naishoryo functioned as the leader of the government craft center during the early Heian period until mid Heian period.
Naishoryo functioned as the leader of the government craft center during the early Heian period until mid Heian period.
Naishoryo functioned as the leader of the government craft center during the early Heian period until mid Heian period.

sen.j: 内匠寮は唐代の官営工房である少府監（しょうふげん）の模倣と考えられ、別称も「少府」という。
sen.e: Naishoryo was considered to be an imitation of the Shofugen which was the government craft center in the Tang Dynasty, and has another name of "Shofu".
Naishoryo was considered to be an imitation of the Shofugen which was the government craft center in the Tang Dynasty, and it had another name; "Shofu".
Naishoryo was considered to be an imitation of the Shofugen which was the government craft center in the Tang Dynasty, and it had another name; 'Shofu.'

sen.j: 本寮の特色として日本古来の律令制期の官吏制度を使わず様々な職人（雑色作手）によって運営されている点である。
sen.e: This bureau is characterized by its operation by various artisans (Zoshiki tsukurite (various craftspeople)) instead of using the system of government officials of the ancient Japanese Ritsuryo system.

This bureau is characterized by operations conducted by various artisans (Zoshiki tsukurite - various craftspeople) instead of using the system of government officials of the ancient Japanese Ritsuryo system.

This bureau is characterized by operations conducted by various artisans (Zoshiki tsukurite - various craftspeople) instead of using the system of government officials of the ancient Japanese Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: これは日本の工業の起点といってもよいだろう。
sen.e: This can be said to be the origin of Japanese industry.
This can be said to be the origin of Japanese industry.
This can be said to be the origin of Japanese industry.

sen.j: 平安時代中期を過ぎると次第に職掌を作物所（つくもどころ）や木工寮・修理職に奪われ形骸化していった。
sen.e: After the mid Heian period, official duties were gradually replaced by posts such as Tsukumodokoro (the post responsible for procuring furnishing goods for the Imperial Court), Mokkoryo (Bureau of Carpentry), and Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs), and gradually became a mere facade.

After the mid Heian period, official duties were gradually replaced by posts such as Tsukumodokoro (the post responsible for procuring furnishing goods for the Imperial Court), Mokkoryo (Bureau of Carpentry), and Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs), and gradually became a mere facade.

After the mid Heian period, official duties were gradually replaced by posts such as Tsukumodokoro (the post responsible for procuring furnishing goods for the Imperial Court), Mokkoryo (Bureau of Carpentry), and Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs), and gradually became a mere facade.
